intro: Galium vernum f. hirticaule, commonly known as the hairy wood-remontant, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine, hairy pubescence. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers clustered in umbels, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its hairy foliage and early flowering make it distinct within its genus.
